info.title: Commerce Webservices
info.description: These services manage all of the common commerce functionality, and also include customizations from installed AddOns. The implementing extension is called commercewebservices.

parameters.description: If this parameter is provided and its value is true, the system tries to execute the request in expert mode (only possible if the current user belongs to group 'sapproductconfigexpmodegroup'.

get.summary: Retrieves the component data.
get.description:
Retrieves the CMS components using the specified identifiers. If you don't provide any component identifiers, all of the components will be retrieved. 
The components list is filtered by the specified catalog, product, or category restrictions. The result is sorted according to the sort parameter.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: catalogCode
parameters.description: Catalog code

parameters.name: categoryCode
parameters.description: Category code

parameters.name: componentIds
parameters.description: List of Component identifiers

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current result page. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC, DEFAULT, FULL.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results returned per page. Default value: 10.

parameters.name: productCode
parameters.description: Product code

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method applied to the return results.

get.summary: Retrieves the page data and the CMS content slots.
get.description:
Retrieves the page data and CMS content slots using the pageLabel/pageId or the code parameter. If you don't provide a value for one of these parameters, the homepage CMS content slots are retrieved. 
Content pages can be filtered using pageLabel/pageId while the other page types can be filtered using the specified code.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Page code. Examples: homepage, electronics, cameras, 585.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC, DEFAULT, FULL.

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Page id. When pageId is provided, pageLabelOrId will be ignored.

parameters.name: pageLabel
parameters.description:
Page label. If no page has a label that matches the page label exactly, try to find pages whose label starts with a section of the page label.
Note: URL encoding on the page label should be applied when the label contains special characters. When pageLabel is provided, pageLabelOrId will be ignored.

parameters.name: pageLabelOrId
parameters.description:
Page Label or Id. If no page has a label that matches the page label exactly, try to find pages whose label starts with a section of the page label. Otherwise, try to find the page by id.
When label and ID values can match, passing in the pageId parameter may result in obtaining variation pages with the same pageLabel but different pageId. Therefore, it is advisable to use both the pageId and pageLabel parameters to ensure accuracy.Note: URL encoding on the page label should be applied when the label contains special characters.

parameters.name: pageType
parameters.description: Page type

400.description: Should not pass both pageLabel and pageId simultaneously. (InvalidPageQualifierException)

parameters.description: Only products that are more recent than the given parameter are returned. The value should be in ISO-8601 format: 2018-01-09T16:28:45+0000.

Retrieves the response from the payment provider after creating the SOP payment subscription. If the payment subscription was created successfully, the payment details are returned. If no response from the payment provider, a "202 Accepted" status is returned. Otherwise, an error response is returned.

Note: The execution of the Try it out button always returns an error because the extended carts controller handles parameters differently depending on which payment provider is used.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier.

parameters.name: cartId
parameters.description: Cart identifier: cart code for logged-in user, cart GUID for anonymous user, or 'current' for the last modified cart.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC,DEFAULT,FULL

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user.

post.summary: Creates the SOP payment details.
post.description:
If the SOP payment subscription was successfully created, the payment details are defined and returned.

Note: The execution of the Try it out button always returns an error because the extended carts controller handles parameters differently, depending on which payment provider is used.

get.summary: Retrieves the component data.
get.description:
Retrieves the CMS components using the specified identifiers. If you don't provide any component identifiers, all of the components will be retrieved. 
The components list is filtered by the specified catalog, product, or category restrictions.The result is sorted according to the sort parameter.

parameters.name: baseSiteId

parameters.name: catalogCode
parameters.description: Catalog code

parameters.name: categoryCode
parameters.description: Category code

parameters.name: componentIds
parameters.description: List of Component identifiers

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current result page. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC, DEFAULT, FULL.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of results returned per page. Default value: 10.

parameters.name: productCode
parameters.description: Product code

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method applied to the return results.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

get.summary: Retrieves the page data and the CMS content slots.
get.description:
Retrieves the page data and CMS content slots using the pageLabel/pageId or the code parameter. If you don't provide a value for one of these parameters, the homepage CMS content slots are retrieved. 
Content pages can be filtered using pageLabel/pageId while the other page types can be filtered using the specified code.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Page code. Examples: homepage, electronics, cameras, 585.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC, DEFAULT, FULL.

parameters.name: pageId
parameters.description: Page id. When pageId is provided, pageLabelOrId will be ignored.

parameters.name: pageLabel
parameters.description:
Page label. If no page has a label that matches the page label exactly, try to find pages whose label starts with a section of the page label.
Note: URL encoding on the page label should be applied when the label contains special characters. When pageLabel is provided, pageLabelOrId will be ignored.

parameters.name: pageLabelOrId
parameters.description:
Page Label or Id. If no page has a label that matches the page label exactly, try to find pages whose label starts with a section of the page label. Otherwise, try to find the page by id.
When label and ID values can match, passing in the pageId parameter may result in obtaining variation pages with the same pageLabel but different pageId. Therefore, it is advisable to use both the pageId and pageLabel parameters to ensure accuracy.Note: URL encoding on the page label should be applied when the label contains special characters.

parameters.name: pageType
parameters.description: Page type

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

400.description: Should not pass both pageLabel and pageId simultaneously. (InvalidPageQualifierException)

get.description: Retrieves the order history of a customer. The response may display the results across multiple pages, when applicable.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: currentPage
parameters.description: Current result page. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC,DEFAULT,FULL

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results returned per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting method applied to the return results.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description:
Filters orders with specified status(es). For example, statuses = CANCELLED returns CANCELLED orders. To filter multiple statuses, separate statuses with "," and all orders with these statuses will be returned. For example, statuses = CANCELLED,COMPLETED,READY returns all orders with statuses CANCELLED, COMPLETED, and READY.
Options available are:
CANCELLING,
CHECKED_VALID,
CREATED,
OPEN,
READY,
CHECKED_INVALID,
ON_HOLD,
ON_VALIDATION,
PENDING_APPROVAL,
SUSPENDED,
COMPLETED,
PAYMENT_AUTHORIZED,
PENDING_APPROVAL_FROM_MERCHANT,
CANCELLED,
PAYMENT_NOT_AUTHORIZED,
PENDING_QUOTE,
APPROVED_QUOTE,
PAYMENT_AMOUNT_RESERVED,
PAYMENT_AMOUNT_NOT_RESERVED,
REJECTED_QUOTE,
APPROVED,
PAYMENT_CAPTURED,
PAYMENT_NOT_CAPTURED,
REJECTED,
APPROVED_BY_MERCHANT,
FRAUD_CHECKED,
ORDER_SPLIT,
REJECTED_BY_MERCHANT,
ASSIGNED_TO_ADMIN,
PROCESSING_ERROR,
B2B_PROCESSING_ERROR,
WAIT_FRAUD_MANUAL_CHECK,
PAYMENT_NOT_VOIDED,
TAX_NOT_VOIDED,
TAX_NOT_COMMITTED,
TAX_NOT_REQUOTED

post.summary: Place an order with authorized payment.
post.description:
This API supports placing order with asynchronous payment patterns like iFrame, hosted payment page and hosted field. With these payment patterns, the payment authorization is done independently with order placement API and the payment result is handled through asynchronous notifications. For instant payment method and delayed payment method, the order is placed directly after customers have successfully submitted the payments but the order process shall be in paused state until the payment notification is received and processed on Commerce side.

Note: API can only be used when the baseStore's payment provider is configured as OPF, and completion of OPF-related order processes is required; otherwise, it will throw an exception.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC,DEFAULT,FULL

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

post.summary: Creates a ticket event.
post.description: Creates a ticket event, which is defined as any kind of updated communication regarding the ticket, such as a new message. The message property is required while the toStatus property is optional.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC,DEFAULT,FULL

parameters.name: ticketId
parameters.description:
Ticket identifier.
Example: ```00000001```.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user

post.summary: Creates an attachment for an event in a ticket.
post.description: Creates an attachment associated with a ticket event.

parameters.name: baseSiteId
parameters.description: Base site identifier

parameters.name: eventCode
parameters.description:
Ticket event code is specific to each event. It is used to identify an event.
Example: ```00000A15```.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Response configuration. This is the list of fields that should be returned in the response body. Examples: BASIC,DEFAULT,FULL

parameters.name: ticketId
parameters.description:
Ticket identifier.
Example: ```00000001```.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: User identifier or one of the literals : 'current' for currently authenticated user, 'anonymous' for anonymous user
